questions.question: "If the dog is barking, then the moon is full." What is the hypothesis?

choices.answer: The moon is full
The dog is barking
The dog is not barking
The not moon is full

questions.question: "If Gotham is in trouble, then Batman is on the way." What is the conclusion?

choices.answer: Batman is on the way
Batman is not on the way
Gotham is not in trouble
Gotham is in trouble

questions.question: "If roses are red, then violets are blue." What is the converse?

choices.answer: If roses are red, then violets are not blue
If roses are not red, then violets are not blue
If violets are blue, then roses are red
If violets are not blue, then roses are not red

questions.question: "If roses are red, then violets are blue." What is the inverse?

choices.answer: If roses are not red, then violets are not blue
If violets are not blue, then roses are not red.
If violets are blue, then roses are red.
If roses are not red, then violets are blue

questions.question: "If roses are red, then violets are blue." What is the contrapositive?

choices.answer: If violets are red, then roses are blue
If violets are blue, then roses are red
If roses are not red, then violets are not blue.
If violets are not blue, then roses are not red.

questions.question: What is the hypothesis? "I will go fishing, if today is Sunday."

choices.answer: I will go fishing
Today is Sunday
I would rather sleep in on a Sunday.

questions.question: What is the hypothesis? "The animal is a mammal, if it is a whale."

choices.answer: It is a whale.
The animal is a mammal.
